question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Quotient uniqueness] Can different ID sets with overlapping IDs produce quotient polynomials that collide, enabling proof forgery across sets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [Setup manipulation] If an attacker controls the DigestKey setup, can they pre-compute it to make all proofs verify for any claimed evaluation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [Partial proof set] Can providing a subset of IDs create proofs that verify incorrectly when used with the full ID set? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Cross-set forgery] Can a proof generated for ID X in IdSet A verify as valid for ID X in a different IdSet B with different poly_roots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: from_slice()] [Size amplification] Can providing IDs that expand to very large poly_roots (via hash collision patterns) cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: with_capacity()] [Power of two amplification] Can attackers exploit next_power_of_two() to force allocation of 2^31 or 2^32 element arrays on 32-bit systems, causing crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [Hash collision DoS] Can attackers craft IDs with hash collisions in HashMap's hasher, degrading performance to O(n) for proof lookup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [HashMap capacity] Does HashMap pre-allocation match the expected proof count, or can dynamic resizing cause performance issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_poly_coeffs()] [Non-deterministic computation] Can floating-point operations or parallel execution in compute_mult_tree produce non-deterministic results across nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [Iteration order] Does HashMap iteration order affect proof generation, and can non-deterministic iteration break consensus in distributed systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: as_vec()] [Unstable ordering] Can the order of IDs in as_vec() differ between invocations due to internal Vec reordering, breaking determinism? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: one()] [Special ID handling] Can Id::one() collide with hash-derived IDs from from_verifying_key(), and does the system handle this collision case? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: new()] [Zero root handling] Does creating an Id with Fr::zero() as root_x break polynomial operations that assume non-zero roots? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Identity polynomial] Can a single-element ID set create a linear polynomial where quotient computation has edge cases? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup() vs compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup_vzgg_multi_point_eval()] [Algorithm consistency] Can the two multi-point evaluation algorithms produce different proofs for the same inputs, breaking verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proofs_with_setup() vs compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Batch vs single consistency] Can batch proof generation produce different results than individual proof generation for the same IDs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Round parameter consistency] Do different round values produce proofs that are incompatible with each other or with the verification logic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_poly_coeffs()] [Tree balance attack] Can attackers craft poly_roots patterns that create unbalanced mult_trees, causing quotient() to produce incorrect results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Tree depth mismatch] Can mult_tree depth be inconsistent with index_of_id, causing out-of-bounds access in quotient computation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Subtree extraction] Can the quotient() function be exploited to extract incorrect subtrees from mult_tree, forging proofs for non-existent IDs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Struct: Id] [Cross-version compatibility] Can Ids serialized with one arkworks version fail to deserialize correctly with another version? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Struct: Id] [Canonical encoding] Does ark_se produce canonical serialization, or can multiple byte representations deserialize to the same Id? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Coefficient vector bounds] Can q_coeffs grow unbounded for certain polynomial structures, causing memory exhaustion in MSM? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_eval_proof_with_setup()] [Zero coefficient handling] Does pushing Fr::zero() maintain security properties of the proof, or can all-zero coefficient vectors break verification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ids/mod.rs] [Function: compute_all_eval_proofs_with_setup()] [Vector size mismatch] Can mismatches between poly_roots length and returned proofs length cause silent data loss or incorrect HashMap entries? (High)
